    • Constructor Detail

      • ControllerExecutor

        public ControllerExecutor(tau.smlab.syntech.controller.Controller controller,
                          java.lang.String folder)
                   throws java.io.IOException
        Instantiates a new symbolic controller executor.
        Parameters:
        controller - instance of the controller interface
        folder - location of the controller files
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if the folder does not contain the controller files

      • ControllerExecutor

        public ControllerExecutor(tau.smlab.syntech.controller.Controller controller,
                          java.lang.String folder,
                          boolean reordering)
                   throws java.io.IOException
        Instantiates a new symbolic controller executor.
        Parameters:
        controller - instance of the controller interface
        folder - location of the controller files
        reordering - whether to turn on bdd reordering during the execution. Reordering may result in better performance generally but causes spikes (a very long single step) once in a while
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if the folder does not contain the controller files

    • Method Detail

      • getNextStates

        public java.util.List<java.lang.String> getNextStates(java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> inputs,
                                                      int maxStates)
        Gets a list of possible next states according to current controller state and inputs. This method may change the inner state of the controller and therefore is not recommended to use for the time being!
        Parameters:
        inputs - map of environment variable names to values
        maxStates - maximum number of states to return
        Returns:
        a list of possible next states as strings

      • getSysVars

        public java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String[]> getSysVars()
        Returns the set of all output (system controlled) variables' names
        Returns:
        the set of all output (system controlled) variables' names

      • getEnvVars

        public java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String[]> getEnvVars()
        Returns the set of all input (environment controlled) variables' names
        Returns:
        the set of all input (environment controlled) variables' names

      • free

        public void free()
        Frees the controller at the end of the execution

      • initState

        public void initState(java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> initialInputs)
               throws java.lang.IllegalStateException,
                      java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Picks a valid initial state according to initial inputs from the environment. If the current state is a deadlock for the environment, i.e., the environment has no choice for inputs that satisfy the assumptions, no initial state is picked.
        Parameters:
        initialInputs - map of environment variable names to values
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if the current state is an environment deadlock
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the current state is not an environment deadlock and the inputs violate the safety assumptions of the environment

      • updateState

        public void updateState(java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> inputs)
                 throws java.lang.IllegalStateException,
                        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Picks a valid next state according to the controller and the next inputs from the environment. If the current state is a deadlock for the environment, i.e., the environment has no choice for inputs that satisfy the assumptions, no next state is picked.
        Parameters:
        inputs - map of environment variable names to values
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if the current state is an environment deadlock
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the current state is not an environment deadlock and the inputs violate the safety assumptions of the environment

      • getCurrValue

        public java.lang.String getCurrValue(java.lang.String varName)
                              throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException,
                                     java.lang.IllegalStateException
        Returns the current value of the specified variable name (either an input or an output)
        Parameters:
        varName - The variable name
        Returns:
        The variable value
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the variable name does not exist in the controller
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if the current state is zero

      • getCurrOutputs

        public java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> getCurrOutputs()
                                                                throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Returns a mapping of all system variables' names to their current values
        Returns:
        a mapping of all system variables' names to their current values
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException

      • getCurrInputs

        public java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> getCurrInputs()
                                                               throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Returns a mapping of all environment variables' names to their current values
        Returns:
        a mapping of all environment variables' names to their current values
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException

      • getCurrValues

        public java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> getCurrValues(java.lang.String... varNames)
                                                               throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Returns a mapping of all specified variables' names to their current values. Each variable name may refer to either an input or an output variable
        Parameters:
        varNames - the variables' names that will be mapped to their current values
        Returns:
        the variables' values as a map between variable name and its value
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if there is a variable name that does not exist in the controller
